content.content: MKR auction accepts stable coins such as usdc, tusd and pax ? Any thoughts ?
content.GPT-summary: The post is a brief question asking if Maker (MKR) auction accepts stable coins such as USDC, TUSD, and PAX, and the author is seeking thoughts on the matter.

content.content: This will avoid Dai losing the peg at this moment , which is about +10% usd on dex now .

Being discussed in chat again. My opinion is that doing a last minute collateral onboarding is fraught with a lot of risk at this point (centralization risk on the stablecoins) and will be slow to complete.   We need to stick with the things that are reasonably quick to do and are more known than unknown. But good to have a thread opened to talk about this.

content.content: To clarify, USDC, TUSD and PAX cannot be used in the auctions for MKR. The reasons it needs to be Dai is because we need to burn Dai to reduce the system debt. Having any of the others doesn’t allow use to re-capitalize Dai (which is the whole point of the FLOP auctions.) What we could do is add a stablecoin as collateral which would allow market makers to lock said stablecoin and mint Dai. This Dai could then be used for the FLOP auctions. However as MakerMan said above, there is risk involved with this.
